metadata.Title: CVE-2019-10206 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium.
metadata.Description:
ansible-playbook -k and ansible cli tools, all versions 2.8.x before 2.8.4, all 2.7.x before 2.7.13 and all 2.6.x before 2.6.19, prompt passwords by expanding them from templates as they could contain special characters. Passwords should be wrapped to prevent templates trigger and exposing them.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-10206` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

ansible - 2.8.6+dfsg-1
No subscription required

notes.Note: ebarretto> Be careful when applying the fix as it might lead to CVE-2019-14856

criterions.comment: ansible package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.8.6+dfsg-1').
